I just ran a strip on bitbucket on the tip of a branch and bitbucket stripped that commit, and anything that had happened after. Regardless of what branch it was in.

This has meant an entire morning of the team trying to sort out what is still in our repository and what got stripped.

If I say "strip this revision", and it's the tip of a branch, it should strip that revision ONLY because there should be nothing else that is based on that commit.

Obviously because it was a strip there is nothing left to audit, nothing to look at. So I have no evidence. But you should be able to recerate easily enough. Create a branch. Commit something to it. Commit a bunch of stuff to a bunch of other branches. Then strip the commit to the branch.

fields.description:
Having merge checks requiring successful builds is great, and the new {{pull-requests}} pipeline feature where it does a merge onto the target branch before running the pipeline is also awesome! But there's an enhancement I'd like to see.

Let's say we have two PRs with incompatible changes; both have successful pipelines when run in isolation of each other. One PR is subsequently merged to master. The other PR could also be merged since it has a green build, however it would be awesome to:

# block merging until a new pipeline is run for the PR, against the new commit on the target branch
# have a setting to allow automatically triggering this new pipeline
fields.summary: Implement a merge check to ensure that a pipeline has run against latest version of target

fields.description:
I currently have a situation where I've got two branches and PRs open. They both branch from a broken commit (B) on master.

{{PR BCLOUD-1}} (commit {{C}}) fixes the breakage\\
{{PR BCLOUD-2}} (commit {{D}}) tweaks the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file, and is essentially unrelated to {{PR BCLOUD-1}}

My repo has a pipelines file with a {{pull-requests: **}} configuration to run the pipeline against a post-merge commit.

{{PR BCLOUD-1}} and {{PR BCLOUD-2}} were both created from commit {{B}}.

In {{PR BCLOUD-1}}, commit {{C}} fixes the breakage and the has a green pipeline.

In {{PR BCLOUD-2}}, the breakage is still present so the resulting pipeline of commit {{D}} merged with {{B}} failed.

At some point later, both PRs were approved and {{PR#1}} was merged.

My state looks something like this:

{code}
          C (pr BCLOUD-1)
       ↗    ↘  (pull request is merged to master)
A -> B  -----> E 
       ↘        
          D (pr BCLOUD-2)
{code}

My question is this:

How can I run a new pipeline for {{PR BCLOUD-2}} against the result of merging {{D}} and {{E}}?

* If I RERUN the existing pipeline, it runs with the old state of the target branch (i.e. merges {{D}} and {{B}}, and the pipeline fails as the breakage is still present)
* If I manually execute a pipeline for the branch with commit {{D}}, using the {{pull-requests: **}} configuration, no merge happens at all (essentially treating it as if it's not a pull-request pipeline at all)

I have some other options:

# Merge master (commit {{E}}) into my branch and push the change
# {{git commit --amend}} commit {{D}} to {{D'}} and force-push it

Instead, it would be great if there was some way to say "hey pipelines, run the pipeline for my PR against the latest state of the target branch". Perhaps a thing in the UI which shows up if the latest pipeline ran against an outdated commit on the target branch?
fields.summary: Could we get a button/some other way to retrigger a pull-request style pipeline against latest target branch state

fields.description:
Currently, if you have a Pipelines .yml file that triggers for PR, then when you re-run, stop, re-run, stop your build, the PR link in the build is not showing.

!28339126-Build_PR_link_empty.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Copy the .yml file below.
# Create a branch
# Create a commit to that created branch
# Create a PR pointing from your created branch to "master" branch (This will create a Pipelines build)
# Go the generated Pipelines build
# *IMPORTANT Step*: Re-run, Stop, Re-run then Stop the build.

*Another use case with the same outcome:*

Just adding here another case where this occurs:

# Let's say first build on a PR is build 1.
# Re-run build 1, so now you have build 2 (re-run of 1).
# Every re-run of build 1 will maintain the link.
# Every re-run of build 2 (which is already a re-run) will not maintain the link.

{code}
#!python

image: docker:stable
 steps:
    - step: &build
        name: Build, test and push image
        script:
          - echo "Script test"

pipelines:
  pull-requests:
    '**':
      - step: *build
{code}

h3. Expected Result
The PR link will still be there after some series of re-runs

h3. Actual Result
The PR link isn't showing after some series re-runs
fields.summary: Pull request pipeline does not show link to PR after 2 reruns

fields.description:
As per the title, the YML validator for Pipelines (https://bitbucket-pipelines.prod.public.atl-paas.net/validator) does not show any syntax errors for yml anchors.

This is highlighted in this example public repository: https://bitbucket.org/rtest123/anchor-indentation/addon/pipelines/home#!

Added by [~tboudale] :

I would also like to add that sometimes a YML anchor also breaks validation in other parts of the yml file.

E.g.

{code}
definitions: 
  steps:
    - step: &build-test
      name: Build and test
      script:
        - echo "hello"
      artifacts:
        - target/**

pipelines:
  branches:
    anchor:
      -step: *build-test
    master:
      - step: *build-test

{code}

Above^ the lack of a space between '-' and 'step' for the branch named 'anchor', is not indicated by the validator.
fields.summary: Better YML validation when configuration uses YML anchors and references

fields.description:
From: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-2330

# Any app for Bitbucket Cloud that wants to use the JS API will load https://bitbucket.org/atlassian-connect/all.js
# This script will in turn load https://d301sr5gafysq2.cloudfront.net/9b9e91d45dab/dist/connect/v5/dist/connect/plugin.min.js
# This minified script has arrow functions (=>) in it, which are a SyntaxError in IE11. This breaks any app page that relies on the JS API in IE11.
# There is no official documentation of support being dropped for IE11.

The fix for this should be having whatever minifier you're using minify to ECMAScript 5.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud apps that load the JS API break in IE11

fields.description:
One artifact I really want out of pipelines is code coverage reports.\\
Most reporting tools support generating plain static (html/js/css) reports.\\
I want to be able to serve these as html for recent pipelines builds rarther than only having access to a zip file
fields.summary: [Pipelines] Serve web types from artifacts

fields.description:
Help (?) > Support sent me to j.a.c.

Please provide an obvious "report a bug in bitbucket" link in the nav that goes to this issue tracker.
fields.summary: Have an obvious feedback flow

fields.description:
When executing commands that take a long time, and don't generate any log output for significant amounts of time, the command duration field is not updated.

This causes an apparent mismatch in build minutes consumed vs build time (especially if the command doesnt generate any output at all).

We should correctly show the elapsed time for each command, rather than the time based on when we last received output.
fields.summary: Display accurate command duration

fields.description: I don't see any reason why selecting a Project is required when creating a repo under a team. It's just another layer of confusion, seeing as these Projects are not at all related to our Jira Software Projects. As is, I have to create a dummy Project to fulfill the requirement of selecting a Project when creating a repo.
fields.summary: Remove Requirement to Select Project for Repo Created Under Team

fields.description:
We would like to create inside a *"PROJECT"*  some folders in order to better organize *"REPOSITORIES"* by grouping them based to folder.

Many Thanks
fields.summary: Creating Sub folders inside Project

fields.description: When someone commits a change to the code, it would be a useful feature to be able to search through such changes from commit messages (not commit descriptions, but commit source line changes).
fields.summary: Searching through code differences from commits

fields.description:
When running a pipeline triggered by a pull request, it would be nice to set the name of the step for the pipeline shown in the pull request status (see attached image). As it's currently working, the name is "Pipeline BCLOUD-20 for Pull request BCLOUD-4" where BCLOUD-20 is the number of pipelines in the system and BCLOUD-4 is the id of the pull request, and there seems to be no way of choosing this.

Related question I posted in community:\\
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Title-for-pipeline-build-status-in-pull-request/qaq-p/1023101#M39337
fields.summary: More information about pipeline from inside pull request

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm big fan of ATLASSIAN services, but there is some kind of bug during pull request submission, I want into your notice that. Most of time when try to create pull request then my screen getting hanged and I can't do nothing until I select to create pull request option again. Kindly address this and I also attached a video regarding the same.

Thanks.
fields.summary: UI getting hanged when creating pull request

fields.description:
h3. The 'Leave repository' link is not working for repos that you have direct access to as an Admin
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a different browser than the one you normally use and create a second Bitbucket account
# Go to your own/regular Bitbucket account, open a repo you own, and give direct Admin access to the second Bitbucket account you created in step 1
# Switch to the second Bitbucket account
# Navigate to the repo you have been granted access to
# In the Source page of the repo, select the 2 dots at the top right corner >> Leave repository

h3. Expected Results
You can revoke your access to the repo

h3. Actual Results
You get the following message and your access is not revoked: !2010400282-Screen%20Shot%202019-03-05%20at%2012.43.27.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Go to the repo's *Settings* >> *User and group access*

In the list of *Users*, select the *x* next to your user to revoke your access
fields.summary: The 'Leave repository' link is not working for repos that you have direct access to as an Admin

fields.description:
It is great that Issue Tracker have ability to add image to description.

However, Similar to Trello, Having ability to paste image that is in clipboard would be nice.

Thanks
fields.summary: Paste Image directly to Description from clipboard.

fields.description: The list of builds in the PR UI are empty save for the icon and time (see attached image). This happens in both Chrome and Firefox. This is very annoying as I then have to jump through several hoops to actually get to the builds.
fields.summary: Links to builds in PRs do not display in new PR experience

fields.description: If using a private image for Pipes was available with the same syntax used for using private step images, this would be super great for wrapping up company specific logic shared across our pipelines.
fields.summary: Use private Docker images as Pipes

fields.description:
Hi there,

I have a request regarding Bitbucket Pipelines.

If I push to {{branch-A}}, I want to run tests using {{branch-A}} envs.

If I push to {{branch-B}}, I want to run tests using {{branch-B}} envs.

I have tried the following but it would revert the env to whatever env I set from the Repository Envs.

*Test*

Prerequisite

* Repository Env already has {{MY_ENV=hello}}

branch A

* step1: MY_ENV=world
* step2: echo $MY_ENV (result: {{hello}})

*Conclusion*

Basically on a new step, whatever ENV I set in the previous step gets reset. I will create an issue in the public issue tracker.

Right now what I am doing is creating duplicate steps that all do the same thing (build, test) but just changes the ENV in the beginning, which isn't a huge issue. It just would be nice to be able to reuse steps instead and just switch out the env.
fields.summary: [Request Bitbucket Pipeline] Switch Environmental Variable values based on Branch

fields.description:
This is a known, reproducible bug, where every Jira issue with more than 7 characters is considered a commit instead of a Jira issue.

For instance, a Jira with the FF-12345678 key will be considered a commit instead of a Jira issue. Because of this, when attempting to link this issue on a commit, Bitbucket will instead attempt to link to commit 12345678, which is incorrect and may lead to confusion.
fields.summary: Jira links for issues with more than 7 hex characters are considered commits instead of issues

fields.description:
h3. After a failed import in the issue tracker, future successful attempts generate the same error message
After a failed import in the Bitbucket issue tracker, a future attempt that might be successful gives the same error message as the first failed attempt.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a zip file (let's call it file1.zip) from a Bitbucket issue tracker and download it to your machine
# Unzip the file in your machine and edit _db-1.0.json_ so the JSON string in there is invalid
# Create a second zip file (file2.zip) from the folder that contains the invalid json
# Create a new repo in Bitbucket Cloud with an issue tracker
# Attempt to import file2.zip in the issue tracker of the new repo
# You should get a message "No db found in archive"
# Then, without leaving the Import & Export page, attempt to import file1.zip (which contains a .json file with valid json)

h3. Expected Results
The import succeds and a message appears to confirm the succesful import

h3. Actual Results
The import succeeds, however the user gets the same error message ("No db found in archive") as the one after the first failed attempt, which is misleading
fields.summary: After a failed import in the issue tracker, future successful attempts generate the same error message

fields.description:
Hi

After creating a pull request and closing the branch it is still possible to continue work on that closed branch. Bitbucket we ui has no idea whats going on and a lot of confusion.
fields.summary: pull request issue

fields.description:
We have a problem with Jira Issues section in Deployment Summary which remains empty. We have connection between Jira and Bitbucket and it works fine as the Jira ticket numbers iar clickable in commit messages.\\
The standard for commit message which we use in our team is in following format "<JRA-123> - Ticket headline here" We have tried to also commits without ticket headline but so far no luck.

Also added some images.

What are we doing wrong?
fields.summary: "Deployment summary" Jira Issues section remains empty with Jira Connection

fields.description:
Microsoft ARM Templates have the ability to have [outputs|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/resource-group-authoring-templates#outputs] that contain details of what was deployed. In order to perform complicated deployments these variable need to be accessed by subsequent scripts, Pipes and Steps.

See https://www.reddit.com/r/programming/comments/avrctg/meet_bitbucket_pipes_30_ways_to_automate_your/ehjdhwh

bq. I want to use these values in the subsequent pipes in my deployment. For example, storage account key, app service URL, app insights instrumentation key etc.
fields.summary: Allow access to microsoft outputs beyond Pipe execution

fields.description:
I added a .svg file to the git repository\\
I try to ckick edit\\
I get an error: You can only edit text files.

Expected behavior: svg is a text file, it can be edited. This should work.
fields.summary: cannot edit svg
Feature request - Pipeline command to modify repository/deployment variables

fields.description:
I have 2 environments I deploy to, and the Pipelines for these deployments are multi-step but the steps are the same. I use variables to pass in details from BitBucket into the scripts that run, and use these variables across the steps. Ideally, I'd like my scripts to be able to use variables in their steps, but the values of those variables vary according to the "deployment".

I can't find a way of using Deployments and Deployment variables to use the same pipeline for the different environments. It doesn't appear possible to have multiple steps in the same pipeline with the same deployment value (test/staging/production).

Deployment variables only seem to be useful for different steps in the same pipeline (i.e. step 1 deploys to test, step 2 deploy to staging, step 3 to deploy to Prod), but it would be useful if a multiple steps could use the same deployment variables, or if a pipeline could run against a particular set of deployment variables (i.e. test/staging/prod)
fields.summary: Support multi-step deployments

fields.description:
I have two environments I deploy to, and two types of deployment I do to each. The deployments are almost identical except for their first step.

I've moved most of the steps to YAML anchors, but I end up with 4 pipeline definitions, each with the same number of steps. It'd be good if I could create a definition that chained other anchor steps. That way I could create an anchor that was steps 2-5, and then my pipelines would simply be "Run Step 1, then the anchor that does steps 2-5"
fields.summary: YAML Anchors calling other YAML Anchors

fields.description:
It would be nice if we can create projects in projects.\\
Here's an example.

!771846507-Screenshot_18.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Feature request: Sub-Projects

fields.description:
"Show More" aka 3 vertical dots:: for getting into user access control, is not working.\\
Sometime it works and most of the time doesn't work.\\
Nothing happens after pressing the button.\\
In Inspect-->Console  error showing : "Offsets separated by white space(s) are deprecated, use a comma (,) instead."
fields.summary: Show more button not working

fields.description:
Hello ,

yesterday i tried to use pipeline , like i do usually every couple of days or something , but  after i run the pipeline it took two hours as mentioned below in the picture. also after i runned the pipeline , i've been seeing a orange-yellow warning box saying that <<bitbucket is encountring an incident, w're on it .>>

and now i cannot push and run the pipeline at all.

I believe it is not caused by our changes (the codes still on bitbucket cloud)\\
Can you kindly answer these two questions?

Why this happened and How can I avoid this?\\
Would these 2 hours counted by our run-time usage?
fields.summary: Exceeded build time limit of 120 minutes.

fields.summary: Backlog Toggl button duplication

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Copy link on "New source browser experience" doesn't copy the link in latest Chrome browser

h3. Environment
* Latest Chrome browser version

###Steps to Reproduce

# Open latest Chrome browser version
# GO to source repositories
# Click the clone button
# Click copy icon
# The link doesn't get copied to the clipboard

###Expected Results\\
The link is copied to the clipboard\\
###Actual Results\\
The link is not copied to the clipboard

###Notes\\
Only Chrome browser affected.
fields.summary: Copy link to clipboard doesn't work on Chrome browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The download repositories UI is showing the repositories size instead of the files size.

###Steps to Reproduce

# Confirm the repositories size
# Go to download tab
# Download tab show repositories size
# Download the files and the size is reduced due to the file is being zipped
# Extract the zip file and the size is reduced half of the UI size

###Expected Results\\
The download UI should show the download file size instead of repositories size\\
###Actual Results\\
The download UI show repositories size which is confusing for the user

###Notes\\
The download UI only download the latest commit heads and does not contain .git folder in it hence the reason to why the size is reduced from the actual repositories size
fields.summary: Repositories download UI show repositories size instead of the size of the download files

fields.description:
Some time in the last 24 hours one of our repos no longer shows commits on the commits web page for branches with very recent commits. Remote repos show no problems so the issue appears to be web server related.

The repo is https://bitbucket.org/k1jt/wsjtx/src/master/ and the last commit visible seems to be https://bitbucket.org/k1jt/wsjtx/commits/7ddcb798fe4d17be7c4d07a2cc4678fe4078f755?at=wsjtx-2.0.1

Regards\\
Bill.
fields.summary: commits web page not showing any commits on branches with recent commits

fields.description:
Hello!

Just came across with an small bug. Tried to upload image in pull request's comments but it displayed '1.png)' instead image.

To reproduce error, add ( or ) in your image name, for example:

screencapture-127-0-0-1-9000-2019-02-28-21_39_30(1).png will display  '1.png)'  instead image\\
screencapture-127-0-0-1-9000-2019-02-28-21_39_30.png will display image
fields.summary: Bitbucket fails to upload images in comments

fields.description:
It'd be great if there is an expand/collapse feature for in-line images and GIFs in Bitbucket pages, in particular, pull requests and commit views.

Sometimes, a pull request comment thread will involve a lot of comments with images or GIFs. The page quickly becomes overwhelmed with media and is easy to get lost.

For example, Slack has this feature. See attachment.
fields.summary: Expand/collapse feature for in-line images and GIFs in Bitbucket pages, in particular, pull requests and commits.

fields.description:
Last night I recevied an automated email at 8:17 PM EST with the title '[Bitbucket]  Pipeline for master failed on 844a626 (.../...)'. The email said the pipeline ran for 3h 43m 7s and contains a link to the pipeline step. When clicking the link I see that the pipeline execution was successful and according to the web ui ran in 13m 44s and was started at 4:33 PM EST. The 3h 43m 7s time is correctly the duration between when the pipeline step was initiated and when I received the email.

This is the first time I've seen this and have no idea how to reproduce it. This happened when merging a PR to master, but nothing was done differently than normal as far as I can tell.

I can provide links to the commit, pipeline step, etc. if you want to reach out directly.
fields.summary: Received "Pipeline for master failed.." Email When Pipeline Didn't Fail

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a team
# Upgrade the team to Premium
# Enforce the "Require two-step verification" in the Access Control settings on the team level
# Create a public repository
# User who's part of the team and has write access to the repository, but doesn't have 2FA enabled, tries to upload a picture to the public repository's Wiki

Expected behavior:\\
Mentioning that 2FA needs to be enabled in order to upload the picture to the Wiki

Actual behavior:\\
No error displayed in the UI, 403 error message is shown in the Console log
fields.summary: Not being able to upload picture to a public repository's Wiki, when 2FA is enforced on account level
